summary: Reads the entire content of a file at the specified path and returns it as a string, returning nil if the file is not found.
Writes the specified text to a file, creating it or overwriting it if it already exists.
Appends the given text to the end of the file at the specified path.
Reads a file line by line and returns an array of strings, removing the newline character from each line.

Deletes the file at the specified path if it exists.

Returns a list of filenames in the specified directory, excluding subdirectories.
Creates a new directory at the specified path if it does not already exist.
Returns the extension of the file at the specified path (e.g., '.txt').
Returns the size of the file at the specified path in bytes.

code:
def read_json_file(file_path)
  require 'json'
  file = File.read(file_path)
  JSON.parse(file)
end
summary: Reads a JSON file and parses its content into a Ruby hash or array.
Writes a Ruby hash or array to a file in pretty-printed JSON format.

code:
def read_csv_file(file_path)
  require 'csv'
  CSV.read(file_path, headers: true)
end
summary: Reads a CSV file and returns a CSV::Table object, treating the first row as headers.

Converts a relative file path to an absolute path.
Changes the permissions of a file using the specified octal mode (e.g., 0644).
Returns true if the specified directory is empty, false otherwise.
Returns an array of filenames matching the specified glob pattern (e.g., '*.rb').
Reads the contents of a file in binary mode.
Writes binary data to a file at the specified path.
Returns the path of the current working directory.

code:
def each_line_with_index(file_path)
  File.foreach(file_path).with_index do |line, line_num|
    puts "#{line_num}: #{line}"
  end
end
summary: Iterates through a file line by line, providing both the line content and the line number.

code:
def temp_file_create
  require 'tempfile'
  Tempfile.create('foo') do |f|
    f.write('Hello')
    f.path
  end
end
summary: Creates a temporary file, writes data to it, and returns its path.
Reverses the characters in a given string.
Capitalizes the first letter of each word in a sentence.

code:
def palindrome?(str)
  normalized = str.downcase.gsub(/[^a-z0-9]/, '')
  normalized == normalized.reverse
end
summary: Checks if a string is a palindrome, ignoring case and non-alphanumeric characters.
Counts the number of vowels in a string.

code:
def snake_case(str)
  str.gsub(/::/, '/').
  gsub(/([A-Z]+)([A-Z][a-z])/, '1_2').
  gsub(/([a-zd])([A-Z])/, '1_2').
  tr("-", "_").
  downcase
end
summary: Converts a CamelCase or other formatted string into snake_case.

code: def truncate_string(str, max_length)\n  str.length > max_length ? \"#{str[0...max_length]}...\" : str\nend

code:
def loop_times(n)
  n.times do |i|
    puts i
  end
end
summary: Executes a block of code a specified number of times.

code:
def iterate_range(start_num, end_num)
  (start_num..end_num).each do |i|
    puts i
  end
end
summary: Iterates through a range of numbers from start to end, inclusive.

code:
def while_loop_example(max)
  i = 0
  while i < max do
    puts i
    i += 1
  end
end
summary: Executes a block of code repeatedly while a condition is true.

code:
def handle_exception
  begin
    1 / 0
  rescue ZeroDivisionError => e
    puts "Error: #{e.message}"
  end
end
summary: Demonstrates basic exception handling using begin, rescue, and end.

code:
def each_with_object_example(arr)
  arr.each_with_object({}) do |item, hash|
    hash[item] = item.length
  end
end
summary: Iterates over a collection, passing a memo object to the block.

code:
def case_statement(grade)
  case grade
  when 'A' then 'Excellent'
  when 'B' then 'Good'
  else 'Keep trying'
  end
end
summary: Uses a case statement to execute different code based on the value of a variable.

code: def ternary_operator(a, b)\n  a > b ? a : b\nend
summary: Uses the ternary operator to return one of two values based on a condition.

code:
def break_loop(arr)
  arr.each do |item|
    break if item == 'stop'
    puts item
  end
end
summary: Terminates the execution of a loop when a condition is met.

code:
def next_iteration(arr)
  arr.each do |item|
    next if item.nil?
    puts item
  end
end
summary: Skips the rest of the current iteration and moves to the next one.

code: def unless_example(condition)\n  puts \"Condition is false\" unless condition\nend
summary: Executes code only if the condition is false.

code:
def define_method_dynamically(name)
  self.class.send(:define_method, name) do
    puts "Method #{name} called"
  end
end
summary: Dynamically defines a new method on a class at runtime.

code: def set_instance_variable(obj, name, value)\n  obj.instance_variable_set(\"@#{name}\", value)\nend

    def old_name; "Old"; end
    alias_method :new_name, :old_name
  end

  my_proc.call(10)
end

code: def reduce_array(arr)\n  arr.reduce(0) { |sum, n| sum + n }\nend
summary: Accumulates a value by applying a block to each element of the array (e.g., summing elements).

Returns true if the block never returns true for any element.

Returns all combinations of length n of elements from the array.

summary: Performs a binary search on a sorted array to find the target element.

Returns an array of every element for which the pattern match returns false.

code: def cycle_array(arr, n)\n  arr.cycle(n) { |x| puts x }\nend
summary: Calls the block for each element n times, or forever if nil is given.

code: def chunk_array(arr)\n  arr.chunk { |n| n.even? }.each { |even, nums| p [even, nums] }\nend
summary: Enumerates over the items, chunking them together based on the return value of the block.
Splits the array into subarrays, starting a new chunk whenever the pattern matches.

code: def slice_when_condition(arr)\n  arr.slice_when { |i, j| i + 1 != j }.to_a\nend
summary: Splits the array into subarrays based on a boolean condition between adjacent elements.

code:
def openssl_encrypt
  require 'openssl'
  cipher = OpenSSL::Cipher.new('AES-128-CBC')
  cipher.encrypt
  key = cipher.random_key
  iv = cipher.random_iv
  encrypted = cipher.update('data') + cipher.final
end
summary: Encrypts data using OpenSSL and AES-128-CBC.

Decompresses a zlib-compressed string.

code:
def observable_example
  require 'observer'
  class Ticker
    include Observable
    def run
      changed
      notify_observers(Time.now)
    end
  end
end
summary: Implements the Observer pattern using the Observable module.

code:
def singleton_example
  require 'singleton'
  class Config
    include Singleton
  end
  Config.instance
end

code:
def pstore_write
  require 'pstore'
  store = PStore.new("data.pstore")
  store.transaction do
    store[:my_key] = "value"
  end
end
summary: Persists data to a file using PStore.

code:
def pstore_read
  require 'pstore'
  store = PStore.new("data.pstore")
  store.transaction(true) do
    store[:my_key]
  end
end
summary: Reads persisted data from a PStore file.

code:
def socket_tcp_server
  require 'socket'
  server = TCPServer.new(2000)
  loop do
    client = server.accept
    client.puts "Hello!"
    client.close
  end
end
summary: Creates a simple TCP server that sends a greeting.

code:
def socket_tcp_client
  require 'socket'
  s = TCPSocket.new('localhost', 2000)
  line = s.gets
  s.close
end
summary: Creates a TCP client that connects to a server and reads a line.
